snippet: Hissène Habré, 69, former dictator of Chad, has lived undisturbed in his luxury villa in Dakar, Senegal, since he fled Chad in 1990. A top court in The Hague will decide where he should be tried.
abstract: International judges in The Hague are hearing a complex case to decide which country has the right to try Hissene Habre, former president of Chad, who has been indicted in both Senegal and Belgium in connection with political killings, torture and other brutalities.
lead_paragraph: Hissène Habré, 69, former dictator of Chad, has lived undisturbed in his luxury villa in Dakar, Senegal, since he fled Chad in 1990. A top court in The Hague will decide where he should be tried.

headline.seo: Hague Court to Decide Where Habré, Chad’s Ex-Dictator, Will Be Tried
headline.main: Hague Court to Decide Where Former Dictator of Chad Will Be Tried
headline.print_headline: Hague Court to Decide Where Former Dictator of Chad Will Be Tried

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
